The Currier Inn and the Boyd Room were both amazing! We loved the atmosphere and the coziness of the room. The location was also amazing, its a walking distance to almost everything you could need. We were afraid that since it was an old building that noise would be an issue, but we never heard the other guests. The inside of the building is also gorgeous.
There are a couple of "negatives" one of which isn't a negative, but something to clarify. This BnB used to actually have a full complimentary breakfast. The Inn was taken over by new management in May and they no longer offer this. This isn't a deal breaker for me as I always overslept breakfast anyway, but for anyone who reads past reviews and sees that breakfast is offered, know that it isn't. The only real negative I have is that since this property was acquired recently there is some work being done on it currently. We experience hammering as early as 9:30 AM all the way up to 2:00 PM. I don't expect this to last long, but it was a nuisance to me, as I said above, I like to sleep in.
I would totally recommend staying here and plan on staying here again myself!

It was a true pleasure to stay at Brad & Christa’s loft for a week! The listing photos are completely accurate. It is a beautifully updated and decorated unit in a charming historical building. You’re next door to a great local coffee shop (the loft’s wonderful balcony directly overlooks their twinkle-lighted back garden) and walking distance to many restaurants. Do yourself a favor and go around the corner to the amazing French bakery! The building is across the street from the UNC campus, a perfect base to visit a student if you have one. That being said, we had no issues with any neighborhood noise. We felt like we were on the best corner to hang out on in Greeley.
The unit is very well equipped, especially the kitchen. The hosts have thought of, and provided, everything you will need. We utilized the two rollaway beds pushed together for our young daughter and they worked great. There was plenty of room in the living area for both. The main bed was very comfortable and we appreciated the blackout curtains in the bedroom.
There is a dedicated parking spot in the back which was great. (Yes, near the dumpster, but this was a non-issue for us). Be aware if you have significant mobility issues that the apartment is up two short flights of stairs.
Communication with the hosts was great and we would happily book the loft again.
